thread.title: Royals come from behind to even series against the Astros
thread.title_full: Royals come from behind to even series against the Astros

author: DAVE SKRETTA
title: Royals come from behind to even series against the Astros
text:
Royals second baseman Ben Zobrist is forced out by Astros shortstop Carlos Correa in the 7th inning of Game 2 of the ALDS at Kauffman Stadium in Kansas City on Friday, Oct. 9, 2015. (Peter Aiken/USA Today Sports) ALDS Royals 5, Astros 4(Series tied 1-1) Royals come from behind to even series against the Astros DAVE SKRETTA KANSAS CITY — The Associated Press 
Published Friday, Oct. 09, 2015 9:39PM EDT 
Last updated Friday, Oct. 09, 2015 9:40PM EDT 
The Kansas City Royals whipped out the same formula that carried them to last year’s World Series to turn back the Houston Astros and tie their American League Division Series at a game each. 
Some clutch hitting. Stingy defence. An unflappable bullpen. 
Even a little help from replay. 
“Just battling,” first baseman Eric Hosmer said. “That’s what this team does so well.” connect with us The Globe and Mail Newspaper
